content: the patrick beanie by jan rich of janknits i found this great skein of dk weight yarn on etsy called friday night fibers by sharpin designs and thought it would make a great beanie for my son patrick to wear for his beloved browns whose team colors are orange and brown first i found the rhinefleck hat and liked the look of it but wanted the crispness of k1tbl x p1 ribbing for the brim and i was not a big fan of the seed stitch ribbing for the body of the hat so i guess i designed a new pattern loosely based on the rhinefleck materials i used 175 yards of dk weight yarn or roughly 70 grams of this luscious superwash merino and mulberry silk size us 5 16 circular needles and size us 5 dpns for finishing yarn needle gauge/size about 22 stitches per 4 in 1 x 1 rib finished size flat unstretched was 7 5 inches and 10 inches from unfolded brim to top stitches used k = knit p = purl k1tbl = knit 1 through the back loop p2tog = purl 2 stitches together ssk = slip two stitches knitwise to right needle stick your left needle through those stitches to the front then knit them together through the back loops or just knit two together through the back loops instructions brim i used german twisted cast on for an extra stretchy edge here s a video cast on 113 stitches and join in the round by moving the first cast on stitch from the left to the right needle then pulling the last cast on stitch over it and off the needle resulting in a nice join and 112 stitches if you want a bigger or smaller beanie add or remove 8 stitches from 112 plus one for the join row 1 *k1tbl p1 and repeat to end of round and repeat this row for the brim for 3 inches main body you ll knit 3 stitches separately through the back loops for k3tbl row 1 *k3tbl p5 and repeat to end of round repeat this row until hat measures 8 5 crown decreases i created this crown to maintain the 3 knit stitch rib until the very last few row and i love how it turned out switch to dpns when you need to i switched at row 11 row 1 *k3tbl p3 p2tog repeat from * around row 2 *k3tbl p4 repeat from * around row 3 *k3tbl p4 repeat from * around row 4 *k3tbl p2 p2tog repeat from * around row 5 *k3tbl p3 repeat from * around row 6 *k3tbl p3 repeat from * around row 7 *k3tbl p1 p2tog repeat from * around row 8 *k3tbl p2 repeat from * around row 9 *k3tbl p2 repeat from * around row 10 *k3tbl p2tog repeat from * around row 11 *k3tbl p1 repeat from * around row 12 *k1tbl ssk p1 repeat from * around row 13
